descript.abstract: Last update: March 11, 2021This data was developed for the Utah Department of Public Safety Bureau of Investigations for use in planning operations throughout the State. It indicates which law enforcement agency has responsibility in a specific area. Identification of local police departments was obtained from the Utah Chiefs of Police Association and from associated 911 dispatch centers. Boundaries for the departments are the current municipal boundaries in SGID. Periodic boundary boundary changes will be made as municipal boundaries change and responsibilities of city police departments will be updated as they become known. Sheriffs Office boundaries are current county boundaries in SGID minus local police department boundaries.More information can be found on the AGRC data page for this layer:https://gis.utah.gov/data/society/public-safety/
descript.purpose: This data was developed for the Utah Department of Public Safety Bureau of Investigations for use in planning operations throughout the State. It indicates which law enforcement agency has responsibility in a specific area.

citeinfo.origin: REQUIRED: The name of an organization or individual that developed the data set.
citeinfo.pubdate: REQUIRED: The date when the data set is published or otherwise made available for release.
citeinfo.title: SGID.SOCIETY.LawEnforcementBoundaries

timeperd.current: REQUIRED: The basis on which the time period of content information is determined.

sngdate.caldate: REQUIRED: The year (and optionally month, or month and day) for which the data set corresponds to the ground.

status.progress: REQUIRED: The state of the data set.
status.update: REQUIRED: The frequency with which changes and additions are made to the data set after the initial data set is completed.

bounding.westbc: REQUIRED: Western-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.
bounding.eastbc: REQUIRED: Eastern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.
bounding.northbc: REQUIRED: Northern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.
bounding.southbc: REQUIRED: Southern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.
theme.themekey: REQUIRED: Common-use word or phrase used to describe the subject of the data set.

idinfo.accconst: REQUIRED: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing the data set.
idinfo.useconst: REQUIRED: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for using the data set after access is granted.

dataIdInfo.idPurp: This data was developed for the Utah Department of Public Safety Bureau of Investigations for use in planning operations throughout the State. It indicates which law enforcement agency has responsibility in a specific area.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Last update: August 24, 2022

This data was developed for the Utah Department of Public Safety Bureau of Investigations for use in planning operations throughout the State. It indicates which law enforcement agency has responsibility in a specific area. Identification of local police departments was obtained from the Utah Chiefs of Police Association and from associated 911 dispatch centers. Boundaries for the police departments are the current municipal boundaries in SGID. Periodic boundary boundary changes will be made as municipal boundaries change and responsibilities of city police departments will be updated as they become known. Sheriffs Office boundaries are current county boundaries in SGID minus local police department boundaries.

More information can be found on the UGRC data page for this layer:

https://gis.utah.gov/data/society/public-safety/

Consts.useLimit:
The data, including but not limited to geographic data, tabular data, and analytical data, are provided "as is" and "as available", with no guarantees relating to the availability, completeness, or accuracy of data, and without any express or implied warranties. These data are provided as a public service for informational purposes only. You are solely responsible for obtaining the proper evaluation of a location and associated data by a qualified professional. UGRC reserves the right to change, revise, suspend or discontinue published data and services without notice at any time. Neither UGRC nor the State of Utah are responsible for any misuse or misrepresentation of the data. UGRC and the State of Utah are not obligated to provide you with any maintenance or support. The user assumes the entire risk as to the quality and performance of the data. You agree to hold the State of Utah harmless for any claims, liability, costs, and damages relating to your use of the data. You agree that your sole remedy for any dissatisfaction or claims is to discontinue use of the data.

cntaddr.state: REQUIRED: The state or province of the address.
cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.

cntinfo.cntvoice: REQUIRED: The telephone number by which individuals can speak to the organization or individual.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
